newsitem.title: GERMANY: German TUI to discuss change in structure - Spiegel.
newsitem.headline: German TUI to discuss change in structure - Spiegel.

text.p: German tour operator Touristik Union International (TUI) plans to hold an extraordinary supervisory board meeting where changes in the group's structure will be discussed, a newsmagazine reported.

In a summary of an article to be published in next week's edition, Der Spiegel said TUI's supvervisory board would on April 29 agree to turn Germany's largest tour operator into a stock company. It is currently a limited commercial partnership.
Spiegel also said that after TUI had been turned into a stock company, it could list its shares on the bourse, obtaining new cash for expansion.
The supervisory board also plans to discuss whether or not TUI might be turned into a holding company, the newsmagazine reported.
For the business year 1995/1996 TUI posted a net profit of 151.2 million marks, down from the year earlier profit of 165 million marks.
